Course Description: THE COURSE  WILL DEVELOP AN  IN-DEPTH  UNDERSTANDING  OF  THE  THEORETICAL FRAMEWORKS  USED  IN  FINANCIAL  REPORTING AND  USE THIS  UNDERSTANDING TO ANALYZE  AND SOLVE COMPLEX ANALYTICAL PROBLEMS IN FINANCIAL REPORTING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
COURSE OBJECTIVES:
1.UNDERSTAND THE FINANCIAL REPORTING CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK, THE ELEMENTS OF THE FINANCIAL 
STATEMENTS, AND UNDERLYING ASSUMPTIONS OF GAAP.
2.UNDERSTAND  WHEN  ELEMENTS  SHOULD  BE  RECOGNIZED,  HOW  THEY  SHOULD  BE  MEASURED 
ADJUSTED, REPORTED, AND DISCLOSED.
3.UNDERSTAND  THE  PURPOSE,  COMPONENTS,  PREPARATION,  AND  INTERRELATIONSHIP  OF  THE  FOUR 
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
4.APPLY KNOWLEDGE OF PRINCIPAL MANUFACTURING INVENTORY COST FLOW METHODS (JOB ORDER AND PROCESS 
COSTING) AS WELL AS DEMONSTRATE UNDERSTANDING OF DIFFERENCE BETWEEN INVENTORY VALUATION FOR RETAIL 
AND MANUFACTURING COMPANIES. 
5.USE KNOWLEDGE TO ANALYZE COMPLEX FINANCIAL REPORTING CASES BY INFERRING BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS AND 
TRANSACTION AMOUNTS USING T-ACCOUNTS AND FULLY USING SIMPLE TECHNOLOGY APPLICATIONS TO RECORD 
EVENTS
PROFESSIONAL  ACCOUNTING TOPICS IS  AN  ELECTIVE  COURSE IN  THE ACCOUNTING CURRICULUM.IT IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE AN IN DEPTH UNDERSTANDING OF SELECTED ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS. STUDENTS WILL LEARN THE FOLLOWING IN THIS COURSE:

1. FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING MEASUREMENT THEORY AND CONCEPTS.
2. THE METHODOLOGY USED BY PROFESSIONAL ACCOUNTANTS IN APPLYING GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES TO BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS TO RECORD REGULAR EVENTS AND ADJUSTING ENTRIES.
3. THE METHODOLOGY USED BY PROFESSIONAL ACCOUNTANTS TO CONSTRUCT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FROM RECORDED TRANSACTIONS. 
4. ANALYTICAL SKILLS THROUGH THE SOLVING OF COMPLEX ACCOUNTING CASES AND PROBLEMS.
5. RELATE INVENTORY COSTING ISSUES ENCOUNTERED IN FINANCIAL REPORTING TO ISSUES ENCOUNTERED IN COST ACCOUNTING.
